stories.text: Not saying wether this is a good idea or a bad idea. But 'burning' cash or deposits into a custodial non-lending account which is attested-to monthly to be holding 100% cash, and which you cannot withdraw from would represent the ultimate voluntary boat burning for those who are serious (and maybe stupid) about creating a money for the internet. Value is not 'locked' until there is no way out. why is this a good or bad idea?
stories.title: Crazy idea: an asset backed stablecoin that you can't redeem for dollars
Researchers test a means to block–and neatly unblock–men’s reproductive ductwork

stories.text:
I often try colabs on Google. Many ask to save files to your Google drive. This makes sense to save the output of calculations. Many colabs do not make sense without it.

But isn't it a security risk to do so?

Is there a way to restrict access to a single folder, so the colab cannot wreck havoc with the rest of your Google drive?
stories.title: Ask HN: Can you restrict Google Colab drive access to a single folder?
